alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Franklin County through 445 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Western Smith Mountain Lake, or 7 miles northwest of Penhook, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Penhook... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Union Hall... North Shore... Southern Smith Mountain Lake... Sontag... and Westlake Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on Smith Mountain Lake in this vicinity, move to shore immediately. You do not want to be caught out on the lake during a thunderstorm. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
